title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)) and with
heading: 3. Regulation 10 of the Housing Assistance Payment Regulations 2014
text_raw:
3. Regulation 10 of the Housing Assistance Payment Regulations 2014 

(S.I. No. 407 of 2014) is amended— 

(a) 

in paragraph (3) (inserted by the Housing Assistance Payment 
(Amendment)(No. 4) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 474 of 2015)) 
by substituting the following for subparagraph (a): 

“(a) The monthly amount set out for the appropriate household 
class in the Table to this Regulation may be increased by a sum 
that does not exceed 35 per cent of the amount concerned, where 
this is necessary to source a suitable dwelling for a qualified 
household in the administrative area of a housing authority 
referred to in subparagraph (b).”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 8th July, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [342] 3 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 
Expenditure and Reform, 

6 July, 2022. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

6 July, 2022. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [342]

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 408 of 2020)) and with
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations amend the Housing Assistance Payment Regulations 2014 
(S.I. No. 407 of 2014) as last amended by the Housing Assistance Payment 
(Amendment) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 56 of 2017). The Regulations provide 
that the maximum rent limits set out in the Table under Regulation 10 may be 
exceeded by not more than 35 per cent in all local authority administrative 
areas, where this is necessary to source suitable accommodation for a 
household that is qualified for social housing support. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [342] 5
